Class Player

java.lang.Object
Entity
Player
public class Player extends Entity
Player-controlled entity.

Extends Entity and implements player-specific behaviour including movement, jumping, gravity interaction, damage handling, win detection, and sprite animation state updates.

Author:
psyjr14

  • Field Details

    • checkPoint

      protected javafx.geometry.Point2D checkPoint

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(int x, int y, int health, javafx.scene.image.Image[] idleSprites, javafx.scene.image.Image[] runningSprites, javafx.scene.image.Image[] hurtSprites, javafx.scene.image.Image shootingSprite)
      Constructs a new player with the given starting position, health, and sprite sets.
      Parameters:
      x - initial x-position in pixels
      y - initial y-position in pixels
      health - starting health value
      idleSprites - idle animation sprites (index 0 is used as the initial image)
      runningSprites - running animation sprites
      hurtSprites - hurt animation sprites
      shootingSprite - sprite shown while shooting

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(boolean[] keys, boolean lastDir, boolean jumpPressed, List<MapBlock> blocks)
      Per-frame update for the player.

      Applies gravity, horizontal movement, jump handling (including double jump), variable jump height, damage timers, win condition checks, and animation updates.

      Parameters:
      keys - key state array (commonly: 0 = left, 1 = right, 2 = jump-held)
      lastDir - last facing direction when no directional keys are pressed
      jumpPressed - true if a jump was requested this frame
      blocks - map blocks used for collision detection

    • desiredCameraX

      public int desiredCameraX(int viewWidth)
      Calculates the desired camera x-position so the player is centred in the view.
      Parameters:
      viewWidth - width of the viewport in pixels
      Returns:
      desired camera x-position

    • isFacingForwards

      public boolean isFacingForwards(boolean[] keys, boolean lastDir)
      Determines the direction the player should face based on inputs.
      Parameters:
      keys - key state array (0 = left, 1 = right)
      lastDir - last facing direction used when no input is active
      Returns:
      true if facing forwards, false if facing backwards

    • isMoving

      public boolean isMoving(boolean[] keys)
      Checks whether the player is moving horizontally.
      Parameters:
      keys - key state array (0 = left, 1 = right)
      Returns:
      true if left or right is pressed

    • isJumping

      public boolean isJumping()
      Checks whether the player is currently jumping (or has jumped).
      Returns:
      true if jumpCounter is greater than zero

    • updateState

      public void updateState(boolean[] keys, boolean lastDir)
      Updates the player's logical animation state.

      State priority (highest to lowest): shooting, hurt, aerial, running, idle.

      Parameters:
      keys - key state array
      lastDir - last known direction used when idle

    • animate

      public void animate()
      Updates the currently displayed sprite based on state and timing.

    • tryShoot

      public Bullet tryShoot(boolean facing, javafx.scene.image.Image bulletImage)
      Attempts to spawn a bullet if shooting is currently allowed.

      Shooting is limited by a cooldown window (justShot) and available ammunition. When a shot is successful, ammunition is reduced, the cooldown timer is started, and a new Bullet is created at an offset relative to the player's position.

      This keeps player-specific shooting rules encapsulated in Player, while the Game class remains responsible for owning and updating the global bullet list.

      Parameters:
      facing - true if the player is facing forwards (right), false if facing backwards (left)
      bulletImage - sprite used for the bullet entity
      Returns:
      a newly created bullet if the shot was fired, or null if shooting was not allowed

    • damage

      public void damage(Enemy e)
      Applies damage and knockback when colliding with an enemy.

      Includes a brief invincibility window controlled by isDamaged.

      Parameters:
      e - enemy that caused the damage

    • hasWon

      public boolean hasWon()
      Returns whether the player has met the win condition.
      Returns:
      true if the player has won

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Checks whether the player is dead due to falling out of bounds or losing all health.
      Returns:
      true if dead
